Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as 4d99c3110e75689e253157fd79428a247239a821
should not this be inside the oem-ibm ? or can this be generic .
I figured, the soft off app itself is in the generic path, and currently entity types are hard coded inside soft off app.
is this needed at the global scope ?
Done
do we need this to be a global variable ?
Done
can we have like a parseconfig() which returns the jsonobject that run as part of the softoff object construction - and move this logic there
Done
we also need the TID from the json, since we could have same entitytype, statesetid across multiple PLDM terminus.
Done
this seem like a redundant variable ? if we figure out that we got just one PDR, then we dont really need to go to the next entry right ?

But the order which we have defined in our Json is that it looks for VMM PDR first and then the system chassis PDR. It will be important when we do not find either PDR from the Json entries then we will have to get to line 193, where we check for this.
removed softoffPdrExist class variable.
if(!softoffPdrExist)
Done
what if the JSON has 2 entries, and only one of them is modelled in the PDR, it is still a valid case right ? should we return an ERROR ?
This condition is hit only after parsing all the entries in the JSON and we do not get any PDR that is modelled.
do we really need them to be class variables ? why can't they be passed over functions ?  (they are being replacing in for loop when we parse the JSON)
Done, but we will still need as class variables as we have passed them as in/out parameters from main.

Can we configure it to hard-wrap at the appropriate width? For instance, in vim you can use gq to wrap the text:

https://vimhelp.org/change.txt.html#gq
Done
what is the value of entityType and stateSetId passed to the constructor ? is it junk ?
Done, initialised to 0.
softoff_config.json can be directly used while fs::path is being constructed. we could eliminate the need for configJson variable ?
Acknowledged
we could rename this function also if we do not return the effecter ID. We could rename it as getEffecterInfo()?

the ultimate aim of this function is to find out the effecterId of the remote PDR that the soft off app needs to trigger for the soft power off of the remote terminus. So I feel it makes more sense to keep it as is. Do you have any strong opinions otherwise?
Acknowledged
do we use this effecter ID? This function just returns success or error right, so do we need to extract that effecter ID?
effecterID is a class variable, it is populated here and used at line number 303 in the same file.

the softoffPdrExist= true by default, and if we hit this exception ? then we dont change it , but assume that the PDR's are present and return success from this function right ? is that supposed to happen ?
yep, had not thought of that. Have changed code to make it false when we hit an exception.
Done
do we need to get the bus for every entry? can we move this out of the for loop?
Done
if(response.size()) ?
Done
can we improve the lg2 trace? - https://github.com/openbmc/docs/blob/master/anti-patterns.md#ill-defined-data-structuring-in-lg2-message-strings''&apos
I see this would be something that will be taken care in https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/pldm/+/70656/3/softoff/softoff.cpp
Done
doxygen update
Done
doxygen update
Done
doxygen update
Done
rather than sending it from here with 0, we could initialise the default value in the private section of the class itself if that is what is needed.
Done
if it is indeed a class variable ? then why do we need to pass it as well ? i think if we want to pass the variable - then we should not have it as a class variable at all.
Done
@sagar - almost close, just couple of minor comments in the doxygen , otherwise it's good to go.
these are not in/out anymore ? just `in`
Acknowledged
same here as well.
Acknowledged
